episodes.title: If they changed this, I would still be a Jehovah's Witness (maybe)
Barbara Anderson, JW Whistleblower and Human Rights Activist
episodes.description:
Barbara Anderson was a dedicated Jehovah’s Witness for over 40 years. While working at headquarters in the 1990s, she made headlines when she exposed a massive CSA coverup perpetrated by Watchtower officials. Jehovah’s Witnesses around the world were subsequently warned not to watch the May 28, 2002 Dateline segment featuring her and former members as they told their stories. Since then, Anderson has been working tirelessly with lawmakers and other key figures to protect children and tighten the reins on clergy-penitent privilege in religious organizations. 

Barbara's first FULL INTERVIEW here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PWW3gdyf-O8

Barbara’s Website: Watchtower Documents: https://watchtowerdocuments.org/

episodes.title: They beat me and shunned me. They won't silence me.
episodes.description:
LaTrina was one of Jehovah's Witnesses for over 20 years. Even though her parents were beloved at the Kingdom Hall, her home life was turbulent and physically abusive. As an adult, she faced a life-altering decision during one of her pregnancies. She was shocked at what she discovered, but was even more shocked by the way the congregation treated her. LaTrina tells her heartbreaking but incredible story of resilience, despite the trauma she faced at the hands of her own Jehovah's Witness family.
